intro: Luzula spadicea f. melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-fruited wood sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which contrast with its grass-like foliage. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its habitat.
